intro: Galium verum var. ruthenicum, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It produces small, dry fruits called capsules, which contain numerous tiny seeds.
